page.title: 18R A F ST MAWGAN
page.content: On the 19.6.85 we went to the only airbase in Cornwall,R.A.F. St.Mawgan.After getting a pass at the gatehouse a Flying Officer drove us to 42.Squadron's officer's mess,which was in a bit of a mess! Another F.O. told us that 42.Squadron was the only on the base.Originally torpedo bombers it is now a nimrod Squadron involved amongest other things,in search and rescue and fishery protection.About 130 people are attached to the Squadron.Up to 40,000 people attend the yearly charity raising airday. Called R.A.F.Treblesue when it opened in 1943 this airbase alone in Britain avoided bombs as it was out of the range of the German planes,now a nimrod can fly from Cornwall to America with out refueling.
